snippet: The expected approval of same-sex marriage in Hawaii has special resonance because the contemporary fight over the issue was born there two decades ago with a pioneering legal case.
abstract: Expected legalization of same-sex marriage in Hawaii has special resonance because the contemporary fight over the issue began there two decades ago with a pioneering legal case; Ninia Baehr and Genora Dancel, along with two other same-sex couples, had filed lawsuit seeking a marriage license and, to near universal shock, was granted victory by Hawaii’s Supreme Court in 1993.
lead_paragraph: The expected approval of same-sex marriage in Hawaii has special resonance because the contemporary fight over the issue was born there two decades ago with a pioneering legal case.

headline.main: Gay Marriage Battle Nears End in Hawaii, the First Front Line
headline.print_headline: Battle Nears End In First Front Line On Gay Marriage

keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
keywords.name: subject
